meanings.definition: Belief in the existence of a supreme being, specifically a creator who does not intervene in the universe.
meanings.sent1: His deism led him to believe in a distant creator.
meanings.sent2: Many philosophers in history have pondered the concept of deism.
meanings.sent3: The idea of deism made the comedian joke about a lazy god.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, deism is like a silent observer.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of deism appeals to those seeking a hands-off deity.

meanings.definition: The belief in a God who created the world but does not actively intervene in its affairs.
meanings.sent1: Deism suggests a creator who set things in motion and stepped back.
meanings.sent2: During the Enlightenment, deism gained popularity among intellectuals.
meanings.sent3: The storybook character's deism made for an interesting plot twist.
meanings.sent4: Like a watchmaker, deism envisions a creator who winds up the universe.
meanings.sent5: The concept of deism paints a picture of a hands-off divine architect.
